definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: Even her soul, so strong for rhapsody, was not enough.
sentences.chinese: 甚至於她那特別善於狂想的靈魂也不足掛齒。

sentences.english: Discusses Rhapsody the style and "a capriccio" correlation of the terminology.
sentences.chinese: 探討狂想曲的風格與“隨想”術語之關連性。

sentences.english: One original caprice for violin solo by N. Paganini or of a comparable level of difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 帕格尼尼小提琴獨奏狂想曲或一首同等難度的作品。

sentences.english: But all this was essentially lunacy.
sentences.chinese: 但這一切基本上是迷夢和狂想。

sentences.english: The second part devotes to the identity analysis and the stylistic features of the two DonRhapsody.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分兩首《頓河狂想曲》的本體分析與風格特徵。

sentences.english: Can't wait to listen to the fantasia!
Almost anyone can recognize Gershwin's Rhapsody in Blue.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎每個人都能夠認出蓋希文的《藍色狂想曲》。

sentences.english: The disease can also cause hallucinations , depression, and paranoia.
sentences.chinese: 這種疾病還可能引起幻覺，抑鬱和狂想症。

definition: like a heavenly steed, soaring across the skies (idiom)/(of writing, calligraphy etc) bold and imaginative/unconstrained in style
see 胡思亂想|胡思乱想[hu2 si1 luan4 xiang3]
